text: Hey <!channel>, have we been preparing in any way for the almost imminent new phone (and asset) sizes coming up soon? I haven't been on any iOS projects lately so I don't know how this affects current or upcoming projects.
Aside from building things as scalable as possible, I don't know that we've made any concrete plants
are there any concrete specs out there yet?
Not really. But many reported on twitter that the latest beta of Xcode had a @3x option.
As always, you never know what Apple will do but that seems to be a good indicator.
right. Well - I have high hopes that they at least maintain their consistency. 3x is one thing, different aspect ratios is quite another
Gruber has a solid post on likely/possible scenarios: <http://daringfireball.net/2014/08/larger_iphone_display_conjecture>
from the sound of this - it sounds like a fairly large paradigm shift for apple
sounds like he's betting on 2208 × 1242 as the final
Yes, was just listening to his podcast when I thought of our projects.

Haven't read the post so I don't know if he talks about this here but one of the big questions for me is what happens to non-optimized apps shown on @3x devices. Are they letterboxed or scaled (or both)?
Im not sure any one knows but I would assume scaled
And some letterboxing when the devices are off diff aspect ratios. I assume.
